title: How to Steam Clean Tile Grout

steps.headline: First, make sure you are using a quality steam cleaner that is able to reach a temperature of a least 175ºC and a decent steam pressure.
steps.description: Commercial or high quality steam cleaners are always your best option.

steps.headline: If you have any brushes with your steam cleaner, use one in nylon or brass and attach it to the lance.
steps.description: The steam will exit through the brush and allow you to perform a much better job as it is more condensed.

steps.headline: Start scrubbing gently in between the tiles until the steam removes the dirt and grime.
If you have one, switch to a rectangular floor tool in order to wash off the residues left behind on the floor.
steps.description: You can also use a cloth and pass over the surface to wipe off the residual dirt.

text: First, make sure you are using a quality steam cleaner that is able to reach a temperature of a least 175ºC and a decent steam pressure. Commercial or high quality steam cleaners are always your best option. If you have any brushes with your steam cleaner, use one in nylon or brass and attach it to the lance. The steam will exit through the brush and allow you to perform a much better job as it is more condensed. Start scrubbing gently in between the tiles until the steam removes the dirt and grime.  If you have one, switch to a rectangular floor tool in order to wash off the residues left behind on the floor. You can also use a cloth and pass over the surface to wipe off the residual dirt.
